content.raw:
Nice to have but not essential idea: for large files, it's nice if small copy errors don't corrupt the entire file. Even more robust would be checksums on portions of the log, but that would probably have performance implications.

I mention this because our current format supports compressed chunks, but an entire chunk can be corrupted if any copy errors are made. Fortunately, each chunk should be independent, but it's another factor to potentially consider, especially for large files.
